div.span: In accordance with Governor Newsom's Order on March 19th, all District campuses and offices are closed to the public until further notice.

div.p: School Locator will help you identify your school of attendance
School Locator will help you identify your school of attendance
First Day of School, 2019. They are getting ready to make their first run of the day.

div.data-alt: First day food prep for Kafe 56

div.p: Culinary students prepare food for their first service

h1.strong: Central Union High School STEM Building

div.p: Construction site with a crane lift steel beams into place

div.div: Grading of assignments, quizzes and tests has already started. Teachers will begin with the 3rd quarter grade from March 13 and will continue assessing students' work and participation in this Distance Learning model through June 3rd. In accordance with the State Superintendent of Instruction's Guidance, teachers can give grades and provide feedback on student work. We recognize there are many situations and challenges. We will work with students and give our best effort. Students must give their best, too.

Most teachers and students are new to this way of learning and we will all do our best to learn as much as we can while we practice social distancing. Most colleges, universities, and employers require online learning as part of the coursework and professional training. This time is great practice for post-high school learning and in your future career.

Thank you to all the parents and families that are supporting your children at this time. We are working on end of year plans as new information becomes available. Please check you school websites for details as they become available.

div.span: If you need a Chromebook to connect to your Google Classroom, other online resources, Student Portal, and teachers, please contact your school or visit their website for more instructions.
For students and families that are stressed or in crisis, the Department of Education has created helpful information. Click here.

div.div: Information on video conferencing: English Spanish

We consider student safety as our number one priority. Parents, please check credible sources of information about your child's school. Each school has a web page and the El Centro Police also has a web page. These are your best sources of information.

h3.img: The Best Tool for Your Future is Education

div.h3: We have just launched new Social Media pages. Follow us!

div.div: This year, we will have a Distance Learning only summer program for all students to make up failed grades, or for Special Education or Migrant Education students.

div.h2: Limited Office Hours for Inter and Intra- District Transfers
div.div: The District Office lobby will be open on Tuesdays and Thursdays beginning April 21 from 8 am to 12 pm. Please wear a face mask when entering the lobby and practice social distancing. Click the link below for more details.

All children up to age 18 can get a grab and go lunch and breakfast from ANY school. It does not have to be where you go to school. Each child getting a meal must be present. Many other locations in our district at elementary schools are serving meals.

em.strong: April 20th, all Schools will provide meal service from 11 AM to 12:30 PM each weak day

div.span: Follow the links below to see each district's schedule

div.div: McCabe ESD is not serving meals

em.strong: All CUHSD campuses are closed Tuesday, March 17th until further notice. As long as the "Stay at Home" orders are in place, campuses will be closed.

div.strong: Campus Closure Letter to Residents, March 16

div.div: The same disease prevention for the common cold is the best practice to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus. Wash your hands, cover you cough and practice social distancing.

div.span: Our e-mail service is being upgraded to Google! Please click the icon or link below to log in to our new Gmail service.

div.div: The State or our Schools 2020 Address was January 15, 2020 in the newly renovated Southwest High School Library at 6:00 PM. Students, Parents and the Public were invited to attend. The IV Press covered the event and ran an article on Jan 17th. Click here to see the article.
